Key Match Events: Pete Alonso led off the second with a laser home run to right field.
Tyrone Taylor hit a ground ball to Pfaadt, who missed the catch to set up two runners on thanks to the error.
Geraldo Perdomo booted a ground ball to drive in yet another run to make it 8-0.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a solo homer in the 7th inning.
Corbin Carroll hit a two-run home run in the 7th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Torey Lovullo said 'The D-backs beat the D-backs in a couple of situations today.'

Lovullo talked after the game about Pfaadt's outing, 'Brandon...didn't have his best stuff but he was out there competing as he always does...We gave them those extra outs and those extra outs equaled unearned runs. That's not what we do here.'
Lovullo shared that 'He (Jordan Montgomery) did his job the way we wanted him to do his job. I'm very proud of him for making the adjustment and figuring it out.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Arizona Diamondbacks lost 8-3 to the New York Mets.
Brandon Pfaadt struggled badly after the first inning, giving up eight runs, six earned, eight hits, a walk, and six strikeouts.
Jordan Montgomery made his debut out of the bullpen to a bases-loaded nightmare, but proceeded to pitch the next four innings and gave up no runs with just five hits and one walk allowed.
Sean Manaea struck out 11 batters for the New York Mets.
